post_text: In accordance with the NDHSAA and the CDC, ND schools have put into place recommendations for fans who attend local sporting events. Rules are school specific, so some schools have put in stricter fan rules/recommendations than others including limiting fans and requiring masks. We recommend checking with neighboring school guidelines before travelling to their fields or gyms for games and events. Napoleon School will be following the CDC guidelines of no more than 500 fans at a gathering, assembly or sporting event. At games, ticket takers will be keeping track of the number of fans who attend an event so we don't exceed 500 people. Napoleon will also ask fans to sit/stand on separate sides of the gym or field as the opposing fans to help physical distancing. Last, we will be limiting our concession items to packaged food items. We would like to thank everyone for their patience and understanding. Go Imperials!

post_text:
Napoleon Community –

Graduation will start at 2 pm on Sunday, July 26th. Graduates and anyone else in the ceremony need to be at the school before 1 pm. Doors will open at 1:30 for parents, family and community members. We will also have it live streamed on our Facebook page.

We will have groups of 4 chairs for families on the gym floor. Everyone else needs to sit in the bleachers. We all need to practice social distancing. Families can sit together in the bleachers but try to keep a six-foot distance between each family. We will label each row of bleachers that you will NOT sit in to help with social distancing.

We will have hand sanitizer available, please use it if needed. Masks are NOT required, but you can wear one if you feel the need. Please limit contact between each other. No handshakes, hugs, etc.

When the ceremony is over, the graduates will line up outside on the grass, about six feet from the sidewalk. Please walk down the sidewalk and congratulate the graduates from a distance. Remember, no hugs, handshakes etc.

The North Dakota Department of Public Instruction has partnered with the Governor’s Office, Forum Communications and Microsoft to produce a virtual Celebration for the North Dakota Class of 2020. This statewide celebration will honor graduates from every high school in North Dakota with a slideshow. Microsoft Teams will enable viewers to listen to guest speakers, including Governor Burgum, Carson Wentz, Josh Duhamel, and a performance by Tigerlily.

Also, the commencement address for this big senior celebration will be given by Napoleon’s very own, Kourtney Bitz!

The North Dakota Class of 2020 Celebration can be viewed on May 30 at 2 p.m. Central/1 p.m. Mountain time by tuning in to your local ABC station (WDAY, WDAZ, KBMY and KMCY) or by visiting Inforum.com, GrandForksHerald.com, JamestownSun.com, TheDickinsonPress.com or WestFargoPioneer.com. The livestreams will be featured at the top of each news site's homepage and will not require registration or subscription to watch.

Microsoft Teams will enable viewers to listen to guest speakers, including Governor Burgum, Carson Wentz, Josh Duhamel, and a performance by Tigerlily.

Also, the commencement address for this big senior celebration will be given by Napoleon’s very own, Kourtney Bitz!

The North Dakota Class of 2020 Celebration can be viewed on May 30 at 2 p.m. Central/1 p.m. Mountain time by tuning in to your local ABC station (WDAY, WDAZ, KBMY and KMCY) or by visiting Inforum.com, GrandForksHerald.com, JamestownSun.com, TheDickinsonPress.com or WestFargoPioneer.com. The livestreams will be featured at the top of each news site's homepage and will not require registration or subscription to watch.
